info.description:
Use this documentation to explore the API in detail.

Each request will have a complete description of all the accepted parameters.

## Authentication

Requests are authenticated using Bearer Tokens. Tokens should be created from within the Hyperfabric service web UI and stored securely.

See the [bearer token](https://developer.cisco.com/docs/hyperfabric/authentication/#bearer-tokens) documentation page for more details.
info.title: Cisco Nexus Hyperfabric REST API

get.description: Get the list of bearer tokens associated with the user.
get.summary: Get the list of bearer tokens.

post.description: Add one or more bearer tokens for the user.
post.summary: Add one or more bearer tokens.

delete.description: Delete a specific bearer token associated with the user.

parameters.description: The id of the token to delete.
parameters.name: tokenId

get.description: Get a specific bearer token associated with the user.
Get the list of devices associated with the organization, both bound and unbound.
Get the list of fabrics in the organization.

parameters.description: Filter by one or more fabric ids and or names.
parameters.name: fabricId

parameters.description: The candidate configuration name. If not set the default candidate configuration values are returned.
parameters.name: candidate

parameters.description: Include object metadata in the response.
parameters.name: includeMetadata

parameters.description: The max number of fabrics to return in the response.
parameters.name: max

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the cursor representing the position of the next set in the list of fabrics.
parameters.name: cursor

post.description: Add a fabric to the organization. Currently only one fabric permitted per call.

get.description: Get a specific fabric.

parameters.description: Include the list of reviews of the candidate configurations.

parameters.description: Include the list of activity events of the candidate configurations.

parameters.description: Start value of the time range in [RFC3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`).
parameters.name: startTime

parameters.description: End value of the time range in [RFC3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`).
parameters.name: endTime

parameters.description: The max number of candidates to return in the response.

authUpdateUserRequest.description: The request to update a specific user.

configReviewFabricCandidateRequest.description: The request to add review comments to a specific candidate configuration of a fabric.

authBearerToken.description: A Bearer Token is a JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authentication and authorization against the Cisco Nexus Hyperfabric REST API. The JWT is a compact, URL-safe means of representing a JSON object containing a set of key-value pairs as described in RFC 7159. It is passed as Bearer token in the Authentication header of every HTTP API request.

description.description: The description is a user-defined field to store notes about the bearer token.

name.description: The user-defined name of the bearer token.

notAfter.description: The end date and time for the validity of the bearer token in [RFC3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`).

notBefore.description: The start date and time for the validity of the bearer token in [RFC3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`).

token.description: This is a read-only field. The JWT token that represent the bearer token. The token is only available at the bearer token creation.

tokenId.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the bearer token.

authBearerTokensResponse.description: Returns a list of bearer tokens.

authCreateBearerTokensRequest.description: Create one or more new bearer tokens.

tokens.description: The new tokens to be created.

authCreateBearerTokensResponse.description: Create a new bearer token. Currently only a single bearer token can be created at a time.

name.description: The user provided name for the token.

notAfter.description: Sets the time after which the token cannot be used.

notBefore.description: Sets the time at which the token can be used.

authSetUsersRequest.description: The request to add one or more users.

users.description: A list of users to be added.

authUpdateUser.description:
Update a specific user.
Update a specific user associated with the organization.

labels.description: A list of user-defined labels that can be used for grouping and filtering Users.

authUsersResponse.description: The response to a request for a list of users.

commonErrCode.description: An error code provides additional information about a failed API request.

commonRestError.description: A REST API Error is returned when the Hyperfabric service failed to execute the received REST API request to inform the user on the type of the error and other useful information for troubleshooting the request.

critical.description: The flag that indicates if the error is a critical error or not.

field.description: The name of the relevant field.

status.description: The HTTP status code associated with the error.

trackingId.description: A unique identifier for each request, used for tracking purposes.

value.description: The value of the relevant field.

configActivityEvent.description: ActivityEvent encapsulates an activity log event.

parentId.description: The object identifier of parent object.

username.description: The user who triggered the activity event.

configAddFabricConnectionsRequest.description: The request to add one or more connections to a specific fabric.

connections.description: A list of connections to be added to the fabric.

configAddFabricNodesRequest.description: The request to add one or more nodes to a specific fabric.

nodes.description: A list of nodes to be added to the fabric.

configAddFabricNodesResponse.description: The response returned to a request to add a list of nodes to a specific fabric.

nodes.description: The list of newly added nodes to the fabric.

configAddFabricStaticRoutesRequest.description: The request to add one or more static routes to a specific VRF in a fabric.

staticRoutes.description: A list of static routes to be added to the VRF.

configAddFabricVniMembersRequest.description: The request to add one or more members to a specific VNI of a fabric.

members.description: A list of members to be added to the VNI.

configAddFabricVnisRequest.description: The request to add one or more VNIs to a specific fabric.

vnis.description: A list of VNIs to be added to the fabric.

configAddFabricVrfsRequest.description: The request to add one or more VRFs to a specific fabric.

vrfs.description: A list of VRFs to be added to the fabric.

configAddFabricsRequest.description: The request to create a fabric.

fabrics.description: A list of one fabric to be created.

configAddFabricsResponse.description: The response returned to a request to create a fabric.

fabrics.description: A list of the newly created fabric.

configAddManagementPortsRequest.description: The request to add one or more management ports to a specific node in a fabric.

ports.description: A list of management ports to be added to the node.

configAddNodeLoopbacksRequest.description: The request to add one or more loopback interfaces to a specific node in a fabric.

configAddNodeSubInterfacesRequest.description: The request to add one or more sub-interfaces to a specific node in a fabric.

configAddPortChannelsRequest.description: The request to add one or more port channels to a specific fabric.

portChannels.description: A list of port channels to be added to the fabric.

configBindDeviceResponse.description: The response to a request to bind a specific device to a node in a fabric.

deviceId.description: The device id or name of the device to bind to the node.

nodeId.description: The node id or name of the node.

configCandidateReview.description: A candidate review is a record created when a user add review comments to a candidate configuration.

comments.description: The comments about the candidate configuration.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the comments were added in [RFC3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`).

createdBy.description: The identity provider and email of the user that added the comments.

configCommitFabricCandidateRequest.description: The request to commit a specific candidate configuration of a fabric.

comments.description: The reasons for the candidate configuration commit.

revisionId.description:
The candidate configuration revision identifier.
The commit request will be rejected if the provided revision identifier is not the same than the most recent one known to the Hyperfabric service.

configCommitFabricCandidateResponse.description: The response to a request to commit a specific candidate configuration of a fabric.

committed.description: Indicates that the pending candidate configuration was committed.

configFabric.description: A Fabric is a collection of nodes, connections that represents the interconnections between the nodes, the configuration of the ports of the nodes and the logical constructs deployed across the fabric such as VRFs, logical networks named VNIs and other services.

address.description: The physical street address where the fabric is located (E.g. 320 My Street).

annotations.description: A list of name-value annotations to store user-defined data including complex data such as JSON associated with the fabric.

city.description: The city in which the fabric is located (E.g. San Jose).

country.description: The country code in which the fabric is located (E.g. US).

description.description: The description is a user-defined field to store notes about the fabric.

fabricId.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the fabric.

labels.description: A list of user-defined labels that can be used for grouping and filtering fabrics.

location.description: The location is a user-defined field to store information about the location of the fabric (E.g. SJC01).

name.description: The user-defined name of the fabric.

configFabricCandidate.description: A candidate configuration represents a staging area for changes to a fabric and its children to be compiled before being reviewed and commited. Once commited, the candidate configuration becomes the running configuration and the candidate configuration is emptied.

active.description: This is a read-only field. The flag that indicates if the candidate configuration has pending changes or not.

createdAt.description: This is a read-only field. The timestamp when this object was created in [RFC3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`).

createdBy.description: This is a read-only field. The identity provider and email of the user that created the candidate configuration.

errors.description: A list of validation errors for active candidate.

events.description: This is a read-only field. A list of the activity events of the candidate configuration.

fabricId.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the fabric to which the candidate is associated to.

modifiedAt.description: This is a read-only field. The timestamp when this object was last modified in [RFC3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`).

modifiedBy.description: This is a read-only field. The identity provider and email of the user that modified the candidate configuration last.

name.description: This is a read-only field. The name of the candidate configuration. Only the `default` candidate configuration is currently support.

reviews.description: This is a read-only field. A list of the reviews of the candidate configuration.

revisionId.description: This is a read-only field. An integer that represents the current revision identifier of the candidate configuration.

txnId.description: This is a read-only field. The transaction sequence number of the candidate configuration.

configFabricConnectionsResponse.description: The response returned to a request for the list of connections in a specific fabric.

connections.description: The list of connections in the fabric

configFabricStaticRoutesResponse.description: The response returned to a request for the list of static routes of a specific VRF in a fabric.

staticRoutes.description: A list of static routes definitions.

configFabricVnisResponse.description: The response returned to a request for a list of VNIs in a fabric.

vnis.description: A list of VNIs in a fabric.

configFabricVrfsResponse.description: The response returned to a request for a list of VRFs in a fabric.

vrfs.description: A list of VRFs in a fabric.

configGetAllFabricsResponse.description: The response returned to a request for a list of fabrics.

cursor.description: The unique identifier of a cursor representing the position in the list of fabrics. A cursor will only be provided if there are more fabrics to be returned.

configGetFabricCandidatesResponse.description: The response to a request for a list of candidate configurations of a specific fabric.

candidates.description: A list of candidate configurations of a specific fabric

configGetFabricNodesResponse.description: The response returned to a request for the list of nodes in a specific fabric.

nodes.description: The list of nodes in the fabric

configGetFabricVniMembersResponse.description: The response returned to a request for a list of members of a VNI in a fabric.

members.description: A list of members of a VNI.

configManagementPortsResponse.description: The response returned to a request for the list of management ports of a specific node in a fabric.

ports.description: The list of management ports of a specific node.

configNode.description: A Node is a logical representation of a device in a fabric that allows the separation to the logical configuration from the actual physical device simplifying RMA and hardware replacements. When associated or bound to a node, a device assumes the node identity and all its associated configuration. A node can be pre-configured and referenced in other fabric level constructs such as VRFs, VNIs and Link Aggregation Groups (LAGs) before a device is bound to it allowing for pre-configuration of a complete fabric.

annotations.description: A list of name-value annotations to store user-defined data including complex data such as JSON associated with the node.

description.description: The description is a user-defined field to store notes about the node.

deviceId.description: The unique identifier of the device associated with the node.

enabled.description: This is a read-only field. The enabled state of the node which indicates if the node is enabled or disabled.

labels.description: A list of user-defined labels that can be used for grouping and filtering nodes.

location.description: The location is a user-defined field to store information about the location of the node (E.g. SJC01).

modelName.description: The name of the hardware model of the node.

name.description: The user-defined name of the node. The name is used as hostname for the node and need to comply with DNS restrictions, is case-insensitive and must be unique in the organization.

nodeId.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the node.

psuAirflows.description: The power supply (PSU) model name and fan airflow direction of the node.

roles.description: A list of roles for the node.

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the device associated with the node.

configNodeLoopbacksResponse.description: The response returned to a request for the list of loopback interfaces of a specific node in fabric.

loopbacks.description: The list of loopbacks of a specific node in a fabric.

configNodeSubInterfacesResponse.description: The response returned to a request for the list of sub-interfaces of a specific node in a fabric.

subInterfaces.description: The list of sub-interfaces of a specific node in a fabric.

configPortChannelsResponse.description: The request for the list of port channels in a specific fabric.

portChannels.description: The list of port channels in the fabric.

configPortsResponse.description: The response returned to a request for the list of ports of a specific node in a fabric.

ports.description: The list of ports of the node.

configReviewFabricCandidateRequest.description: The request to add review comments to a specific candidate configuration of a fabric.

comments.description: The comments to be added as a review to the candidate configuration.

configReviewFabricCandidateResponse.description: The response to a request to add review comments to a specific candidate configuration of a fabric.

configSetFabricConnectionsRequest.description: The request to update the list of connections in a specific fabric.

connections.description: The list of connections for the fabric.

configSetPortsRequest.description: The request to update the list of ports of a specific node in a fabric.

ports.description: The list of ports of the node.

miscDevice.description: A Device is a physical device such as a Cisco 6000 switch managed by Cisco Nexus Hyperfabric that can be bound to a node in a fabric.

claimedAt.description: This is a read-only field. The timestamp at which the device was claimed.

deviceId.description: This is a read-only field. The device identifier of the device.

fabricId.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the fabric of the node to which the device is bound.

fabricName.description: This is a read-only field. The name of the fabric that the devices belongs to.

modelName.description: This is a read-only field. The model name of the device.

name.description: This is a read-only field. The name of the device.

nodeId.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the node to which the device is bound.

roles.description: This is a read-only field. A list of roles associated with the node to which the device is bound.

serialNumber.description: This is a read-only field. The serial number of the device.

miscGetDevicesForOrgResponse.description: The response to a request for a list of devices.

modelsAirflowType.description: Airflow defines an enumeration of types of fan airflows.

modelsAnnotation.description: Annotation defines a typed name/value pair to store user-defined data including complex data such as JSON.

name.description: The user-defined name used to uniquely identify the annotation.

value.description: The value of the annotation expressed as a string.

modelsCandidateType.description: CandidateType defines an enumeration of candidate types.

modelsConfigOrigin.description: ConfigOrigin is used by a management port to indicate if the configuration was provided by the cloud or the device.

modelsConfigType.description: ConfigType is used by a management port to indicate if the IP configuration is static or DHCP.

modelsConnSourceType.description: ConnSourceType defines an enumeration of source types for a connection.

modelsConnectedState.description: ConnectedState is used by a management port to indicate if the port is successfully connected to the Hyperfabric service. It is distinct from the AdminState.

modelsDataType.description: DataType defines an enumeration of data types.

modelsEntitlementLevel.description: An entitlement level governs the extent to which a user can configure a fabric.

modelsFabricTopology.description: FabricTopology defines an enumeration of types of fabric topologies.

modelsInterfaceStp.description: The Spanning Tree Protocol (STP) interface configuration for the port. The configuration is only used when a VLAN is deployed on the port.

bpduGuard.description: BPDU guard enforces that the connected device does not send STP BPDUs on the port. If STP BPDUs are received on the port where BPDU guard is enabled the port will be automatically shutdown. User can re-enable the port administratively after ensuring the BPDUs have stopped coming on the port.

enabled.description: The enabled state of the Spanning Tree Protocol (STP) which indicates if STP is enabled or disabled on the port. Requires at least one of the other properties to also be enabled.

portFast.description: PortFast allows ports to move to forwarding state quickly when the connected device that is not participating in spanning tree. PortFast is enabled by default on all ports.

rootGuard.description: Root guard enforces the root bridge placement in the network and allows STP to interoperate with user network bridges while still maintaining the bridged network topology that the administrator requires. When BPDUs are received on a root guard enabled port, the STP state will be moved to "Root inconsistent" state to indicate this condition. Once the port stops receiving superior BPDUs, root guard will automatically set the port back to a FORWARDING state after the timeout period has expired.

uplinkFast.description: UplinkFast feature enhances STP performance for switches with redundant uplinks. Using the default value for the standard STP forward delay, convergence following a transition from an active link to a redundant link can take up to 30 seconds; 15 seconds for listening and an additional 15 seconds for learning. UplinkFast maintains a list of backup path to the root bridge and immediately move one of the backup paths to forwarding state to speed up the network recovery.

modelsInterfaceType.description: InterfaceType defines an enumeration of network interface types.

modelsLacpMode.description: LacpMode defines an enumeration of LACP modes.

modelsLoopback.description: A Loopback is a logical network interface of a Node used as source interface to peer at Layer 3 with external devices.

annotations.description: A list of name-value annotations to store user-defined data including complex data such as JSON associated with the loopback.

autoCreated.description: This is a read-only field. A flag that indicates if the loopback was automatically created by the system.

description.description: The description is a user-defined field to store notes about the loopback.

fabricId.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the fabric to which this loopback belongs to.

id.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the loopback of the node in the fabric.

ipv4Address.description: The IPv4 host address with subnet mask to be configured on the loopback.

ipv6Address.description: The IPv6 host address with subnet mask to be configured on the loopback.

labels.description: A list of user-defined labels that can be used for grouping and filtering loopbacks.

name.description: The name of the loopback. Must be in the format Loopback\<Integer\>.

nodeId.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the node to which this loopback belongs to.

vrfId.description: The unique identifier of the VRF to which this loopback is attached to.

modelsManagementPort.description: A management port encapsulates the configuration and properties of an Out of Band network interface of a node used to communicate with the Cisco Nexus Hyperfabric service.

cloudUrls.description: A list of one or more Cloud URLs used by a node.

description.description: The description is a user-defined field to store notes about the management port.

dnsAddresses.description: A list of one or more DNS IP addresses used by the node.

enabled.description: The administrative state of the management port which indicates if the management port is enabled or disabled.

id.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the management port.

ipv4Address.description: The IPv4 host address for the management port of the node.

ipv4Gateway.description: The IPv4 gateway address for the management port of the node.

ipv6Address.description: The IPv6 host address for the management port of the node.

ipv6Gateway.description: The IPv6 gateway address for the management port of the node.

loginPassword.description: The password to be used by the system user to login to the node. An empty password is treated as "use current password", and not as "no password".

name.description: The name of the management port of the node (E.g. eth0)

noProxy.description: A list of IP addresses or domain names that should not be proxied.

nodeId.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the node to which this management port belongs to.

proxyAddress.description: The URL for a configured HTTPs proxy for the node.

proxyCredentialsId.description: A unique identifier of a set of credentials for the proxy.

proxyPassword.description: A password to be used to authenticate to the proxy. Once set, this attribute is not returned.

proxyUsername.description: A username to be used to authenticate to the proxy.

setProxyPassword.description: The flag to indicate that the proxy password should be cleared.

modelsMetadata.description: Metadata defines a map of attributes related to the lifecycle of the object.

createdAt.description: This is a read-only field. The timestamp when this object was created in [RFC3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`).

createdBy.description: This is a read-only field. The identity provider and email of the user that created this object.

modifiedAt.description: This is a read-only field. The timestamp when this object was last modified in [RFC3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`).

modifiedBy.description: This is a read-only field. The identity provider and email of the user that modified this object last.

revisionId.description: This is a read-only field. An integer that represent the current revision of the object.

modelsNetworkInterface.description: NetworkInterface encapsulates properties of a network interface attached to a VRF. A NetworkInterface maybe a network port, VLAN interface (SVI), loopback, port channel or a sub-interface.

ipv4Addresses.description: IPv4 addresses of network interface. IPv4 addresses are readonly, and are set by some APIs (E.g. GetVrfs API when NeedIps is set to true).

ipv6Addresses.description: IPv6 addresses of network interface. IPv6 addresses are readonly, and are set by some APIs (E.g. GetVrfs API when NeedIps is set to true).

name.description: The name of the network interface.

nodeId.description: The node identifier where the interface is located. API users may specify either node name or node identifier.

vlanId.description: VLAN identifier - required only for VLAN interface. Name field is ignored when VlanId is specified.

vni.description: The parent VNI of the VLAN. Valid only for VLAN interfaces.

modelsNetworkPort.description: A Port encapsulates the configuration and properties of a front panel network interface of a node used as fabric port to interconnect with other nodes, as routed port to peer at Layer 3 with external devices, as Link Aggregation Group member or as a host port to connect to other endpoints via Layer 2 (VLAN).

annotations.description: A list of name-value annotations to store user-defined data including complex data such as JSON associated with the port.

breakout.description: This is a read-only field. The flag that indicates if the port is in breakout mode or not.

breakoutIndex.description: This is a read-only field. The index number of the breakout in the parent port. The breakout index is not set when the port is not in breakout mode.

description.description: The description is a user-defined field to store notes about the port.

enabled.description: The enabled state of the port which indicates if the port is enabled or disabled.

fec.description: The Forward Error Correction (FEC) mode of the port. Supported modes are "rs" and "none". The FEC must be set to "none" for 100G DR/FR/LR pluggable optics.

forceCounter.description: The Force Counter can be incremented to force the port configuration to be forcefully reapplied when there are no other configuration changes such as to recover (un-shut) a port blocked by STP.

id.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the port.

index.description: This is a read-only field. The index number of the port on the linecard.

ipv4Addresses.description: A list of up to two IPv4 host addresses with subnet mask to be configured on the port. Requires the `ROUTED_PORT` role to be configured in roles and the port to be associated with a VRF.

ipv6Addresses.description: A list of up to two IPv6 host addresses with subnet mask to be configured on the port. Requires the `ROUTED_PORT` role to be configured in roles and the port to be associated with a VRF.

labels.description: A list of user-defined labels that can be used for grouping and filtering ports.

linecard.description: This is a read-only field. The index number of the linecard to which this port belongs to.

linkDown.description: Prevent traffic from being forwarded by the port. Requires `enabled` to be set to `true` (equivalent to `Admin State` set to `Up`) and role to be one of `UNUSED_PORT`, `ROUTED_PORT` or `HOST_PORT`.

maxSpeed.description: This is a read-only field. The maximum speed of the port as reported by the system (E.g. 10G).

mtu.description: The Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) of the port of the node. Default value is 9216 for "FABRIC_PORT" and 9100 for all other roles. The MTU value must be 9216 for "FABRIC_PORT" and between 1500 and 9100 for all other roles.

name.description: The name of the port of the node. The name must have a prefix of Ethernet (E.g. Ethernet1_1) and cannot be modified.

nodeId.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the node to which this port belongs to.

pluggable.description: The name of the model (PID) of the pluggable cable or optic expected to be used in the port.

portAlias.description: The name alias of the port.

roles.description: A list of roles of the port. The port roles list is mandatory, and must contain exactly one role.

speed.description: The configurable speed mode of the port (E.g. 10G). The port speed cannot be set for a port in breakout mode.

subInfCount.description: This is a read-only field. The number of sub-interfaces configured on the port.

vlanIds.description: This is a read-only field. A list of VLAN IDs deployed on the port of the node.

vnis.description: This is a read-only field. A list of VNIs attached to the port of the node.

vrfId.description: The unique identifier of the VRF associated with the port. The VRF identifier is required for a port with the `ROUTED_PORT` role.

modelsNodeRole.description: NodeRole defines an enumeration of roles that can be associated with a node.

modelsNodeType.description: NodeType defines an enumeration of node types.

modelsObjectType.description: ObjectType defines an enumeration of types of objects.

modelsOperation.description: Operation defines an enumeration of the types of operations or actions.

modelsOsType.description: OsType defines an enumeration of various device operating system types.

modelsPerVlanStp.description: The Spanning Tree Protocol (STP) configuration for the fabric. Nexus Hyperfabric uses per-VLAN spanning tree plus (PVST+) and uses the same bridge ID for all Nexus Hyperfabric switches.

enabled.description: The enabled state of the Spanning Tree Protocol configuration which indicates if STP is enabled or disabled.

fabricId.description: This is a read-only field. The identifier of the fabric to which the STP configuration applies to.

priority.description: The bridge priority value as a multiple of 4096 used with the bridge MAC address to form the STP bridge ID. Default value is 0, and range is 0-61440.

stpMac.description: The bridge MAC address used with the bridge priority to form the STP bridge ID. Default value is "00-00-00-00-00-01".

modelsPortChannel.description: A Port Channel encapsulates the configuration and properties of a set of front panel network interface of one or more nodes grouped in a LACP bundle used as a host port to connect to other endpoints via Layer 2 (VLAN).

annotations.description: A list of name-value annotations to store user-defined data including complex data such as JSON associated with the port channel.

description.description: The description is a user-defined field to store notes about the port channel.

enabled.description: The enabled state of the port channel which indicates if the port channel is enabled or disabled.

fabricId.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the fabric to which this port channel belongs to.

id.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the port channel.

labels.description: A list of user-defined labels that can be used for grouping and filtering port channels.

maxSpeed.description: The maximum speed of the port channel (E.g. 100G).

members.description: A set of ports (E.g. Ethernet1_1, Ethernet1_4 etc.) of one or more nodes to be grouped in a LACP bundle.

minLinks.description: The minimum number of active links needed for the port channel to operate.

mtu.description: The Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) of the port channel. Default value is 9100. The MTU value must be between 1500 and 9100.

name.description: The name of the port channel. Name must have a prefix of PortChannel (E.g. PortChannel1).

roles.description: A list of roles of the port channel. The port roles list is mandatory, must contain exactly one role, and it must be "HOST_PORT".

vlanIds.description: This is a read-only field. A list of VLAN IDs deployed on the port channel.

vnis.description: This is a read-only field. A list of VNIs attached to the port channel.

modelsPortConnection.description: A Connection represents the bidirectional physical interconnection between two ports of two nodes in a fabric. The role of the ports in a connection will be automatically configured as `FABRIC_PORT`. Cisco Nexus Hyperfabric uses the connections to generate a possible Bill Of Material, cabling plan and to verify the correct implementation of the desired connectivity intent in a fabric.

cablePid.description: The type or name of the model (PID) of the cable to be used for the connection.

description.description: The description is a user-defined field to store notes about the connection.

fabricId.description: This is a read-only field. The identifier of the fabric to which this connection belongs to.

id.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the connection.

pluggable.description: The type or name of the model (PID) of the pluggable cable or optic expected to be used for the connection.

remotePluggable.description: The type or name of the model (PID) of the pluggable cable or optic expected to be used for the remote end of the connection

remoteRailId.description: The identifier and name of the rail to which this connection belongs to.

unrecognized.description: This is a read-only field. The flag that indicates if the remote side of the connection is recognized or not.

modelsPortEndpoint.description: PortEndpoint defines a globally unique port location or endpoint.

nodeId.description: The unique identifier of the node.

nodeName.description: The user-defined name of the node.

portName.description: The canonical name of the port (E.g. Ethernet1_1).

modelsPortRole.description: PortRole defines an enumeration of roles of ports or port channels.

modelsPortType.description: PortType defines an enumeration of categories of ports.

modelsPsuAirflow.description: A PSU airflow object represents the power supply (PSU) model name and fan airflow direction of the node.

psuModel.description: The name of the model (PID) of the power supply (PSU) of the node.

modelsRouteInfo.description: RouteInfo defines a specific single IPv4 or IPv6 static route which inludes an IPv4 or IPv6 prefix in CIDR notation and a next-hop address of the same IP version.

discard.description: The flag that defines if the traffic matching the static route is silently discarded or not. This is also referred to as a null route or a black hole route.

interface.description: The next-hop interface or network port name.

nextHop.description: The next-hop IP address. Must be a host IP address.

nextVrf.description: The name of the VRF where the next-hop is present.

nodeId.description: The unique identifier of the node where the route is deployed.

preference.description: The route preference value (ascending) which sets the administrative distance. The range is from 1 to 255.

prefix.description: The IPv4 or IPv6 prefix in CIDR notation.

modelsRouteTag.description: RouteTag defines an enumeration of custom route tags. The following values are reserved and should not be used, TAG_AMBER

modelsStaticRoutes.description: The Static Routes object is a child object of a VRF that encapsulates a set of IP static routes pointing to a next-hop. The next-hop must be accessible through one of the routed interfaces associated with the parent VRF.

annotations.description: A list of name-value annotations to store user-defined data including complex data such as JSON associated with the static routes.

description.description: The description is a user-defined field to store notes about the static routes.

enabled.description: The enabled state of the static routes which indicates if the static routes is enabled or disabled.

fabricId.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the fabric to which this static routes belong.

id.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the static routes object.

labels.description: A list of user-defined labels that can be used for grouping and filtering static routes.

name.description: The user-defined name of the static routes. The static routes name has to be unique, and is case-insensitive.

routes.description: A list of IP static route definitions.

vrfId.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the VRF to which this static routes belong to. The VRF identifier is immutable once set.

modelsSubInterface.description: A dot1q VLAN Sub-Interface is a virtual network interface that is associated with a VLAN ID on a routed front panel network interface of a Node used as source interface to peer at Layer 3 with external devices. The parent interface of a Sub-Interface is a Node Port with the `UNUSED_PORT` or `ROUTED_PORT` role.

annotations.description: A list of name-value annotations to store user-defined data including complex data such as JSON associated with the sub-interface.

description.description: The description is a user-defined field to store notes about the sub-interface.

enabled.description: The enabled state of the sub-interface which indicates if the sub-interface is enabled or disabled.

fabricId.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the fabric to which this sub-interface belongs to.

id.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the sub-interface of the node in the fabric.

ipv4Addresses.description: A list of up to two IPv4 host addresses with subnet mask to be configured on the sub-interface.

ipv6Addresses.description: A list of up to two IPv6 host addresses with subnet mask to be configured on the sub-interface.

labels.description: A list of user-defined labels that can be used for grouping and filtering sub-interfaces.

name.description: The name of the sub-interface of the node. Must be in the format Ethernet1_1_1.\<VLAN_ID\>.

nodeId.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the node to which this sub-interface belongs to.

parent.description: This is a read-only field. The name of parent interface to which this sub-interface belong to.

vlanId.description: The VLAN ID used as dot1q encapsulation for the sub-interface. The VLAN ID must be between 1 and 4094.

vrfId.description: The unique identifier of the VRF to which this sub-interface is attached to.

modelsSvi.description: A Switch Virtual Interface (SVI) or VLAN interface is a logical Layer 3 interface that connects a VLAN to a Layer 3 virtual routing and forwarding (VRF) instance and acts as a gateway for the hosts connected to the VLAN. A Static Anycast Gateway SVI is an SVI deployed on multiple devices enabling the use of the same gateway IP addresses across all the nodes that are part of a VNI.

enabled.description: The enabled state of the SVI which indicates if the SVI is enabled or disabled.

ipv4Addresses.description: A list of up to two IPv4 host addresses with subnet mask to be configured on the SVI. If there are two IP addresses on the SVI, then there are two possibilities. 	a) If IPS are in two different networks, then SVI gets two networks. 	b) If IPS are in the same network, then the first IP address is the primary gateway 	  and second IP address is the secondary gateway.

ipv6Addresses.description: A list of up to one IPv6 host address with subnet mask to be configured on the SVI.

modelsTokenScope.description: TokenScope defines an enumeration of scopes that represents different level of privileges that can be associated with bearer tokens and API keys.

modelsUser.description: A User is a Cisco.com account, identified by email, authorized to access a specific Cisco Nexus Hyperfabric Organization with a specific role that represents the level of privilege of the user. Only a user with administrative privileges may modify another user's user record.

email.description: The email address of the user.

enabled.description: The enabled state of the user which indicates if the user is enabled or disabled.

id.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of a user.

labels.description: A list of user-defined labels that can be used for grouping and filtering users.

lastLogin.description: This is a read-only field. The last recorded web interface login time of the user in [RFC3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) format (e.g. `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`).

modelsUserRole.description: UserRole defines an enumeration of roles that represents different level of privileges that can be associated with a user.

modelsVlanMember.description: A VNI VLAN Member represents the attachement of a specific VNI to a port or port channel untagged or using a dot1q VLAN ID (also known as a trunk). The role of the port or port channel has to be configured as `HOST_PORT`.

memberId.description: This is a read-only field. The Vlan member id.

untagged.description: The flag that defines if the VNI VLAN member is configured as untagged or not.

vlanId.description: The VLAN ID to be used as dot1Q encapsulation for the VNI on a port of the node or a port channel. The VLAN ID must be between 2 and 3600.

modelsVni.description: A VNI represents a Layer 2 or Layer 3 logical network that can be extended across the fabric and mapped to a VLAN ID on specific ports and port channels. A VNI can be mapped to a VRF and configured with an SVI to serve as an Anycast Gateway.

annotations.description: A list of name-value annotations to store user-defined data including complex data such as JSON associated with the VNI.

description.description: The description is a user-defined field to store notes about the VNI.

enabled.description: This is a read-only field. The enabled state of the VNI which indicates if the VNI is enabled or disabled.

fabricId.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the fabric to which this VNI belongs to.

id.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the VNI.

labels.description: A list of user-defined labels that can be used for grouping and filtering VNIs.

name.description: The user-defined name of the VNI. The VNI name has to be unique, and is case-insensitive.

svis.description: A list of Switch Virtual Interfaces (SVIs) for the VNI.

vni.description: The VXLAN Network Identifier (VNI) used for the VNI. The value must be between 2 and 6000000.

vrfId.description: The unique identifier of the VRF associated with the VNI.

modelsVrf.description: A VRF is a virtual-routing-and-forwarding instance that represents a routing table deployed across nodes in the fabric to implement VRF-lite and the ability to have multiple routing tables on a single device. A VRF can be associated to multiple VNIs configured with an Anycast Gateway SVI.

annotations.description: A list of name-value annotations to store user-defined data including complex data such as JSON associated with the VRF.

asn.description: The Autonomous System Number (ASN) used for the VRF external BGP peering.

description.description: The description is a user-defined field to store notes about the VRF.

enabled.description: This is a read-only field. The enabled state of the VRF which indicates if the VRF is enabled or disabled.

fabricId.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the fabric to which this VRF belongs to.

id.description: This is a read-only field. The unique identifier of the VRF.

interfaces.description: This is a read-only field. A list of interfaces that are associated with the VRF.

isDefault.description: This is a read-only field. The flag that indicates if the VRF is the default (auto-created) VRF or not.

labels.description: A list of user-defined labels that can be used for grouping and filtering VRFs.

name.description: The user-defined name of the VRF. The VRF name has to be unique, and is case-insensitive. The name should start with `Vrf`, `VRF`, `VRf` or `VrF`, followed by an optional `-` separator and end with an alpha-numeric string of 1 to 16 character.

vni.description: The VXLAN Network Identifier (VNI) used for the VRF.

http.description: A bearer token issued by the service
